dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Exports spatially referenced genetic data from a Feature Class to an Excel file formatted for use in GenAlEx (Peakall and Smouse 2006, 2012), an MS Excel Add-In created to run various genetic analyses in Excel.

For more information go to the GenAlEx website (http://biology.anu.edu.au/GenAlEx).

Required Inputs:

  • An existing Feature Class with spatially referenced genetic data (e.g., co-dominant microsatellite and/or haplotype)

  • An Identification Field, which distinguishes unique individuals or observations for analysis.

  • A Population Field from the attribute table that can be used to organize the data by distinct populations or groupings

  • A File Path and File Name for the Output Text File

Optional Inputs:

  • A Where Clause option to identify and select only those Feature Class records with genetic data

    NOTE: If your data only contains genetic records, this parameter can be left blank.

Outputs:

  • An Excel file with two workseets, one for microsatellite data and one for haplotype data. This file is formatted to meet the input file format for GenAlEx.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Created by the geneGIS team: Dori Dick, Shaun Walbridge, Scott Baker, Dawn Wright

tool.name: ExportGenAlEx

param.name: Input_Feature_Class
param.dialogReference: Select a Feature Class containing spatially reference genetic data.

param.name: Primary_Identification_Field
param.dialogReference: The identification column used to determine which observations are unique. In many studies, this will be the Individual ID, but could also be sample ID or other unique criteria.

param.name: Where_Clause
param.dialogReference: If the feature class contains spatially referenced data that are not genetic, use the Where Clause to select only those records containing genetic data.

param.name: Population Field
param.dialogReference:
Select a field from the attribute table that can be used to sort the data by population or grouping.

For example, select the field 'Region' to sort the data by the region from where each sample was collected (e.g. SEAK, CentAM, Hawaii, etc.).

param.name: Output_File
param.dialogReference: Provide a file path and file name for the Output Excel File.

tool.summary:
Exports spatially referenced genetic data from a Feature Class to an Excel file formatted for use in GenAlEx (Peakall and Smouse 2006, 2012), an MS Excel Add-In created to run various genetic analyses in Excel.

For more information go to the GenAlEx website (http://biology.anu.edu.au/GenAlEx).

Required Inputs:

  • An existing Feature Class with spatially referenced genetic data (e.g., co-dominant microsatellite and/or haplotype)

  • An Identification Field, which distinguishes unique individuals or observations for analysis.

  • A Population Field from the attribute table that can be used to organize the data by distinct populations or groupings

Optional Inputs:

Outputs:

  • An Excel file with two workseets, one for microsatellite data and one for haplotype data. This file is formatted to meet the input file format for GenAlEx.
tool.usage: Exports spatially referenced genetic data to an Excel file formatted for input into GenAlEx.
